oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Pharmacokinetics and Electrocardiographic Effects of Verapamil in the Cat
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Pion, P. D.
Babish, J.
Schwark, W.
Hornbuckle, W.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: verapamil
oral administration
intravenous administration
multidose oral administration
cats
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Pharmacokinetic and electrocardiographic parameters were determined after the administration of single dose oral (S.O.), single dose intravenous (I.V.) and multidose oral (M.O.) verapamil HCâ„“ to healthy cats. The intravenous data were best described by a two compartment open model. Oral data were best described by a one compartment model. The half life of elmination was 1.93, 4.73 and 2.66 hours after I.V., S.O. and M.O. administration. The volume of distribution was identical (2103 ml/kg) after I.V. and S.O. dosing. Bioavailability after S.O. was 29%. In any individual cat, the PR interval varied linearly with the natural log of the plasma concentration of verapamil. However, there was a large interindividual variability in the effects of verapamil on atrioventricular conduction. It was concluded that verapamil could be safely administered to cats on a M.O. or I.V. dosage regimen.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: AAVPT Biennial Symposia; Fifth Biennial Symposium; 141-153
